result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Steven Sanderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt:
10:55 a.m. Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement filed. Schiek/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 18 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Comply with any court orders regarding child support.
Jail credit - 56 days if revoked
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given. 
Adj. 11:08 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

8:43 a.m. Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement--defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek advises Information will be same as Criminal Complaint. Court orders Information to be filed end of today. Defendant pleads not guilty to all 4 counts. Burns statement to bond-requests signature bond. Court statement--denies bond modification. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 10:45 am.

3:24 p.m. Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in court via video with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:25 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:45 am.
No leaving the State of Wisconsin. Contact Public Defender's office within twenty-four hours to determine eligibility.

1:16 p.m. Court Commissioner John J. Hogan. Defendant Richard Steven Sanderson in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he was released from prison in Florida yesterday.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact public defender's office,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $5000 cash  bond. Adj. 1:20 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
per Nicole at ONSO - now in custody in ONSO
Per Mary, ONSO Dispatch, Detainer place Broward County, FL.
